description: From Middle English oxegang, from Old English oxangang (“1⁄8 hide or ploughland”), equivalent to ox +‎ gang.

entries.meaning: (historical) The area of land that could be plowed by an ox in a year, 1⁄8 hide or carucate and notionally 15 acres.
(historical, Scotland) The similar Scottish concept, 1⁄8 of a ploughgate and notionally 12+1⁄2 or 13 Scottish acres.
